thread.title: Dev Patel: Trump travel ban 'terrifies me'
thread.title_full: Dev Patel: Trump travel ban 'terrifies me'

title: Dev Patel: Trump travel ban 'terrifies me'
text: Dev Patel: 'I'm a product of immigrants' 01:56 Story highlights Patel was flying to the United States last week when the travel ban went into effect Patel is only the third actor of Indian decent to be nominated for an Oscar (CNN) The "divisive nature" of President Donald Trump's travel ban "terrifies me in a way," Oscar-nominated actor Dev Patel said Wednesday. "I'm a product of immigrants," he told CNN's Alisyn Camerota. Patel said his parents moved to the UK from Kenya and are "completely proud to be British." Oscar nominated actor @Dev_Patel says "divisive nature" of Trump's travel ban "terrifies me in a way." https://t.co/hkroSiI55N â€” New Day (@NewDay) February 8, 2017 The actor said he was on a flight to the United States when the travel ban went into effect. "It was quite overwhelming, very sad. It's kind of a strange situation when you're walking a red carpet and at the same time people are out marching the streets because of so much strife in the air," he said. Trump signed the executive order January 27. It bars citizens of seven Muslim-majority countries -- Iraq, Syria, Iran, Libya, Somalia, Sudan and Yemen -- from entering the US for 90 days, all refugees for 120 days and indefinitely halts refugees from war-torn Syria. The order was temporarily blocked by a Seattle Court on February 3 and is now being considered by the 9th Circuit Court of Appeals. Read More A video posted by CNN (@cnn) on Jan 29, 2017 at 7:56pm PST Patel also talk about his Oscar-nominated performance in the movie "Lion". The film is based on the true story of a 5-year-old boy who gets lost on a train in India and ends up 2,000 miles away. Twenty-five years later he sets out on a quest to find his real family. "I think the idea of accepting people and that kind of unity I talk about in this film is so important" he said. Patel is only the third actor of Indian decent to be nominated for an Oscar. The movie itself is up for six Academy Awards. Watch New Day weekdays at 6am-9am ET. For the latest on New Day click here Sections
